talk.author: did:plc:ivqrehafyybffh7yxmwhf5n5
talk.utter:
> I know, but as I said, it doesn't even need to be added to the official #activitypub standard. Then it doesn't cost any extra time.

That is a very bad approach to protocol design. While you don't need everyone to adopt it, you still need to design it in a way that's interoperable.

talk.author: did:plc:ivqrehafyybffh7yxmwhf5n5
talk.utter:
It must work in a way that would allow all currently existing mastodon instances to interact with any account on your custom instance.

And you will still get a lot of pushback even without trying to standardize it.

talk.author: did:plc:ko4q2nth6k46rsimakpo4jlt
talk.utter:
#threads shows one possible way.

Of course, there are always different technical approaches with advantages and disadvantages.

But none of this is a reason why I can use my #mastodon account to interact with #threads users but not with #bluesky users.
